newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Boeing says may resume talks with EU on merger.
newsitem.headline: Boeing says may resume talks with EU on merger.

text.p: Boeing Co may re-start discussions with the European Commission on its proposed merger with McDonnell Douglas Corp after the talks were suspended on Tuesday, Boeing's vice-president for European affairs Jim Frank said on Thursday.
"Our discussions with the Commission have been suspended but they may resume at any time," Frank told Reuters.

A committee of antitrust experts from the 15 European Union states advised the Commission on Wednesday to block the $14 billion merger, agreeing with the Commission's competition services that the U.S. aircraft giant had not fully met its concerns.
The Commission is expected to follow that recommendation at its regular meeting on Wednesday.
Sources familiar with the talks were pessimistic that a last-minute agreement would be reached, as happened with some controversial mergers and acquisitions reviewed by the Commission in the past.

But the experts committee encouraged the Commission to continue negotiations which were broken on Tuesday. Members of the U.S. Congress on Wednesday said the EU's Boeing stance was outrageous and a White House spokesman urged the EU to review the case solely on the basis of European antitrust law.
